title: Can the DUP really afford to alienate their allies with this baffling stance on Brexit?
text:
The unionists could be gambling with a lot of valuable goodwill if they are seen to frustrate Brexit

Lord Palmerston famously said there were only three people who understood the Schleswig-Holstein question. One had gone mad, the other was dead, and the third – himself – had forgotten the answer. Even those most sympathetic to the DUP in Northern Ireland have been similarly baffled as to what kind of Brexit the largest unionist party in Northern Ireland wants.

Sometimes its leaders talked the language of hard Brexit. At others, they seemed open to the idea of the whole UK staying in the customs union, even if that wasn’t really Brexit at all. All those contradictions have now reached a point...
description: The unionists could be gambling with a lot of valuable goodwill if they are seen to frustrate Brexit
